author: jpsnover
body:
Running as Admin with full PowerShell running on W10 I see:

```
PS> cmd /c dir /ah c:\pagefile.sys
 Volume in drive C has no label.
 Volume Serial Number is B6ED-8BC6

 Directory of c:\

08/30/2016  06:10 PM     3,758,096,384 pagefile.sys
               1 File(s)  3,758,096,384 bytes
               0 Dir(s)  28,159,082,496 bytes free
PS> dir -Force -Hidden c:\pagefile.sys
dir : Cannot find path 'C:\pagefile.sys' because it does not exist.
At line:1 char:1
+ dir -Force -Hidden c:\pagefile.sys
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (C:\pagefile.sys:String) [Get-ChildItem], ItemNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : PathNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetChildItemCommand

PS> dir -force -Hidden c:\pag*
dir : Could not find item C:\pagefile.sys.
At line:1 char:1
+ dir -force -Hidden c:\pag*
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (C:\pagefile.sys:String) [Get-ChildItem], IOException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : ItemNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.GetChildItemCommand
PS> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.0.10586.494
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.10586.494
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

@jpsnover I updated the issue text and wrapped the console log in the code snippet block. This keeps github from applying markdown formatting rules (i.e. turning 

```
+ dir -Force -Hidden c:\pagefile.sys
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```

 into a list: 
- dir -Force -Hidden c:\pagefile.sys
- ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Please, use this technique and [other markdown formatting](https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet) to format issues.

Also seeing this on Anniversary Update:

```
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.14915.1000

Interestingly, `Get-ChildItem -Force` shows the pagefile until I get specific. 

Three .sys files here:

```
